title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS STRENGTHENED

description.narrative: Output 2.1: Social protection systems strengthened to improve the focus on the most vulnerable., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation, Evaluation (Covid), Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2: Evidence generated for policy advocacy for inclusion in social services by 2020.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF GENDER AND FAMILY AND S SERVICES
THE OXFORD POVERTY AND HUMAN DEVELO OPHI

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Humanitarian research and research in fragile/conflict-affected settings
Improved and integrated social proteciton data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Policy and strategy development and coordination
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Social protection systems strengthened to improve the focus on the most vulnerable.

description.narrative: UNICEF;Maldives;mobilized resources and actively engaged;with government ministries, departments and CSOs to identify vulnerable populations;in the country so that;appropriate;interventions can be designed;based on evidence. A;Multidimensional Vulnerability Index;was developed and used;to;identify the concentration of vulnerability and;adequately;address;this.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/01/2022
